1.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

2.brief: to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

3.brief: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the west (as a region of the evening sun)
properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

4.brief: to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

5.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish

6.brief: to shriek; (by implication) to proclaim (an assembly)
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

7.brief: to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population

8.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to course (like a beast of prey); by implication, to seek greedily
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

10.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)
iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme

12.brief: properly, to bend the knee; hence, to humiliate, vanquish
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to surround, i.e. protect or aid

13.brief: to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)
properly, chastisement, i.e. (by implication) a halter; figuratively, restraint

kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor
copper, hence, something made of that metal, i.e. coin, a fetter; figuratively, base (as compared with gold or silver)
iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement
to fell a tree; generally, to destroy anything

17.brief: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)

18.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

19.brief: to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

20.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks

21.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

22.brief: to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)
properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)

23.brief: to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, deputyship, i.e. ministry; generally, employment (never servile) or work (abstractly or concretely); also property (as the result of labor)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
a deep place (of water or mud)

25.brief: to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves)

26.brief: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to melt, i.e. literally (to soften, flow down, disappear), or figuratively (to fear, faint)

to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)
intoxicated, as astate or a habit
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy

a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population

there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
a family, i.e. circle of relatives; figuratively, a class (of persons), a species (of animals) or sort (of things); by extension a tribe or people

probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
